creator: moe2266us@yahoo.com
text:
Hi;
i'm getting this error now when running "make" for version 2.0.49:

libtool: link: `user/unix/groupinfo.lo' is not a valid libtool object
make: 1254-004 The error code from the last command is 1.

creator: wrowe@apache.org
text:
Please verify the behavior persists in the current release, which happens
to be 2.0.55

If so, you may wish to rerun ./buildconf with a locally installed, hacked
flavor of libtool supporting AIX's compile/link semantics.  But check first
that this wasn't already resolved.
What steps do you take to build after unpacking 2.0.55? What level of AIX is this?
creator: trawick@apache.org
wrowe@apache.org
text:
Please don't open multiple bugs for a single issue.

*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of 38756 ***

these are the steps:

get the tar file.
gunzip 
tar xvf tar_file
cd httpd-2.2.0

> ./configure --prefix=/opt/compitf/comp/vendor/Apache-2.2.0 --with-
mpm=worker --without-berkeley-db --enable-mods-shared=most --disable-threads --
with-module

make


this when i get the errors.
I'm using AIX 5.3 & the GCC version is below



moe@AIX# gcc -v
Reading specs from /opt/freeware/lib/gcc-lib/powerpc-ibm-aix5.3.0.0/3.3.2/specs
Configured with: ../configure --with-as=/usr/bin/as --with-ld=/usr/bin/ld --
disable-nls --enable-languages=c,c++ --prefix=/opt/freeware --enable-threads --
enable-version-specific-runtime-libs --host=powerpc-ibm-aix5.3.0.0
Thread model: aix
gcc version 3.3.2
creator: moe2266us@yahoo.com
